docs.lead_paragraph: ALAMOGORDO, N.M., Aug. 6 Last October, when the Ernest Lee Huckleby family butchered a hog, stored the meat in their freezer and began eating it at meals, the cuts of pork on their plates resembled any others. They looked the same, smelled the same and tasted the same.

headline.main: Mercury in Food: A Family Tragedy; Mercury in Food: A Family Tragedy, a Federal Nightmare

docs.abstract: Article on 3 NM children who are still gravely ill 8 mos after eating meat from hogs contaminated with mercury; only 1 is expected to recover; their med problems described; events preceding and following poisoning detailed; Roswell Rehabilitation Center med dir Dr R N Muckleroy says not much is known about mercury poisoning but drs believe it destroys brain cells and nerve tissue; NM and center are paying costs of hosp care for children; father and mother, who also ingested large quantities of mercury, have not been affected; illus
docs.snippet: ALAMOGORDO, N.M., Aug. 6 Last October, when the Ernest Lee Huckleby family butchered a hog, stored the meat in their freezer and began eating it at meals, the cuts of pork on their plates resembled any others. They looked the same, smelled the same...

byline.original: By MARTIN WALDRON Special to The New York Times
